word_mean: 蜉蝣：属于蜉蜉目(Epheme-roptera)的有两对或一对三角形膜状翅的昆虫，见Hexagenia bilineata

sentence.Network_en: In May 1911 the Mayfly was found to lack sufficient lift to get airborne.

sentence.Network_en: Mayfly larvae live in water, becoming an adult prior to undergo a'sub - adult stage. "

entry.def: A mayfly is an insect which lives near water and only lives for a very short time as an adult.

means.word_mean: 1. slender insect with delicate membranous wings having an aquatic larval stage and terrestrial adult stage usually lasting less than two days

auth_sentence.content: Mayfly nymphs may spend up to three years underwater, breathing through feathery gills.

auth_sentence.content: The mayfly is unique among insects in that it emerges as an immature form, perfectly equipped with wings but incapable of mating.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The mayfly is unique among insects in that it emerges as an immature form, perfectly equipped with wings but incapable of mating.

auth_sentence.content: Like the Mayfly that soars in the sky, for its one brilliant day in the warm spring Sunshine.
